actor_awards.notes: Renowned for her versatility in radio, stage, film, and television. Best known to TV audiences as Endora on 'Bewitched'. She was a key member of Orson Welles' Mercury Theatre.

filmography.title: Citizen Kane
filmography.role_description: The cold, stern mother of Charles Foster Kane who sends him away to be raised by a banker. Moorehead's film debut.
filmography.plot: Following the death of a publishing tycoon, news reporters scramble to discover the meaning of his final utterance.

filmography.title: The Magnificent Ambersons
filmography.role_description: The high-strung, neurotic aunt of the protagonist who watches the decline of her wealthy family with despair.
filmography.plot: The spoiled heir to a decaying family fortune comes between his widowed mother and the man she has always loved.

filmography.title: Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
filmography.role_description: The loyal, slovenly, and suspicious housekeeper who tries to protect her employer from a family plot.
filmography.plot: An aging, reclusive Southern belle plagued by a horrifying family secret descends into madness when her cousin arrives to evict her.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Mrs. Parkington
filmography.role_description: A French baroness and wise confidante to the main characters, spanning several decades.
filmography.plot: A lady's maid marries a wealthy man and rises in society, recounting her life story at age 84.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Johnny Belinda
filmography.role_description: The protagonist's hard-working aunt who helps raise her deaf-mute niece.
filmography.plot: A doctor in a remote fishing village helps a deaf-mute woman learn sign language, but she faces tragedy and a trial.

filmography.title: Dark Passage
filmography.role_description: A spiteful, nagging woman whose testimony convicted the protagonist and who continues to cause him trouble.
filmography.plot: A man convicted of murdering his wife escapes from prison and works with a young woman to prove his innocence.

filmography.title: Show Boat
filmography.role_description: The domineering and shrewish wife of Captain Andy, who disapproves of the riverboat lifestyle.
filmography.plot: The daughter of a riverboat captain falls in love with a charming gambler, but their romance is threatened by his gambling habits.

filmography.title: All That Heaven Allows
filmography.role_description: The best friend of the protagonist, a widow who faces social ostracism for falling in love with a younger gardener.
filmography.plot: An upper-class widow falls in love with a younger, bohemian gardener, which prompts disapproval from her children and country club friends.

filmography.title: Jane Eyre
filmography.role_description: Jane's cruel and unloving aunt who sends her away to a harsh boarding school.
filmography.plot: After a harsh childhood, an orphan becomes a governess at Thornfield Hall, where she falls in love with her brooding employer.

filmography.title: Pollyanna
filmography.role_description: A hypochondriac invalid who is perpetually grumpy until Pollyanna's optimism transforms her outlook.
filmography.plot: A young orphan girl comes to a town that is embittered and depressed and brings a little sunshine into everyone's lives.

filmography.title: Magnificent Obsession
filmography.role_description: A loyal friend and nurse who supports the blind protagonist through her tribulations.
filmography.plot: A reckless playboy inadvertently causes the blindness of a woman he loves and dedicates his life to becoming a surgeon to cure her.

filmography.title: Caged
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic and reform-minded prison superintendent fighting against a corrupt system.
filmography.plot: A young innocent woman is sent to prison for being an accessory to a robbery and is hardened by the brutal environment.

filmography.title: Since You Went Away
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, selfish socialite and hoarder who criticizes the sacrifices made by others during the war.
filmography.plot: With her husband away at war, a woman struggles to keep her family together and support the war effort on the home front.

filmography.title: Charlotte's Web
filmography.role_description: The voice of the stuttering Goose who befriends Wilbur the pig. One of her final film roles.
filmography.plot: A gentle spider saves the life of a pig by weaving messages in her web.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: The matriarch of the Prescott family in the 'The Rivers' segment of this epic western.
filmography.plot: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

filmography.title: The Woman in White
filmography.role_description: The wife of the villainous Count Fosco in this adaptation of Wilkie Collins' mystery novel.
filmography.plot: A young artist is hired to give art lessons to a young woman at a country estate, where he uncovers a sinister plot.

filmography.title: The Left Hand of God
filmography.role_description: The wife of a doctor at a Chinese mission who becomes suspicious of the new priest.
filmography.plot: A soldier of fortune disguises himself as a Catholic priest to escape a Chinese warlord.

filmography.title: Our Vines Have Tender Grapes
filmography.role_description: The mother in a Norwegian-American farming family in Wisconsin.
filmography.plot: A year in the life of a Norwegian farming community in Wisconsin, seen through the eyes of a young girl.

filmography.title: The Bat
filmography.role_description: A mystery novelist who rents a summer home and investigates a series of murders committed by a killer known as 'The Bat'.
filmography.plot: A crazy killer known as 'The Bat' is on the loose in a mansion full of people.

filmography.title: Dragon Seed
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in the adaptation of Pearl S. Buck's novel about Chinese resistance to Japanese occupation.
filmography.plot: Chinese peasants fight to survive the Japanese invasion of their village during World War II.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Aline MacMahon)

filmography.title: The Big Street
filmography.role_description: A cynical friend of the main character, adding sharp wit to the ensemble.
filmography.plot: A humble busboy devotes his life to a selfish, invalid nightclub singer who treats him with contempt.

filmography.title: Journey Into Fear
filmography.role_description: A henpecked wife on a ship carrying an American engineer targeted by Nazi agents.
filmography.plot: An American engineer in Turkey becomes a target for Nazi agents who want him dead.

filmography.title: Station West
filmography.role_description: The owner of a gold mine and saloon who becomes a suspect in a robbery investigation.
filmography.plot: An army intelligence officer goes undercover to investigate the murder of two soldiers and the theft of gold shipment.

filmography.title: Rawhide
filmography.role_description: A woman traveling with her niece who gets held hostage at a stagecoach station by outlaws.
filmography.plot: Four escaped convicts take a woman and a station master hostage at a remote stagecoach station.

filmography.title: Bachelor in Paradise
filmography.role_description: A judge involved in the legal troubles of an author studying suburban life.
filmography.plot: An author moves into a suburban community to write about the wives living there, causing scandal and jealousy among the husbands.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Bob Hope)

filmography.title: The Swan
filmography.role_description: The imperious mother of the Crown Prince who visits the family estate.
filmography.plot: A princess is urged by her mother to marry a crown prince, but her heart belongs to the family tutor.
